intro: Calycera sympaganthera var. pectinata, commonly known as the pectinate calycera, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features distinctive pectinate leaf margins, which give it its varietal name. Its flowers are typically small and white or pale yellow, arranged in clustered umbels. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and ecologically significant species.
